meanings.sent1: After being sick, he felt very weak and tired.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge looked weak and shaky.
meanings.sent3: The weak kitten tried to meow loudly but only managed a squeak.
meanings.sent4: Her weak attempt at singing made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The weak flame flickered and almost went out.

meanings.definition: Not able to withstand great force or pressure
meanings.sent1: The weak rope snapped under the heavy load.
meanings.sent2: The weak lock couldn't keep the door closed.
meanings.sent3: The weak umbrella turned inside out in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: His weak argument fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The weak dam burst under the pressure of the water.

meanings.sent1: The weak ruler had little control over the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: Her weak position in the company made it hard to make decisions.
meanings.sent3: The weak battery couldn't even power a small toy.
meanings.sent4: His weak voice was easily drowned out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The weak leader struggled to rally support for the cause.

meanings.sent1: The weak coffee tasted bland and watery.
meanings.sent2: The weak signal on the radio kept cutting out.
meanings.sent3: The weak joke fell flat with no one laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her weak attempt at painting lacked depth and color.
meanings.sent5: The weak sunlight barely illuminated the room.
